event.title: 2010 census, although the town is part of the larger Evansville metropolitan area which recorded

data.event: The population was 3,325 at the 2010 census, although the town is part of the larger Evansville metropolitan area which recorded a population of 342,815, and Ohio Township, which Newburgh shares with nearby Chandler has a population of 37,749 in the 2010 Census.

Shortly after the mid-nineteenth century Newburgh's growth leveled off until the economic boom of the 1960s and 70â€™s resulted in substantial growth as a bedroom community for families looking for new housing developments near Evansville.
Today, Newburgh is locally known for its charming, historic downtown district that features a number of specialty stores, antique shops, and quaint dining establishments along its riverfront.
